Class TreeBuilder

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void buildTree(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> matrixPrime, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> lColFuncMap)
      Builds the PhyTree when given M' and the LColFuncMap Uses Gusfield's 1991 phylogenetic tree algorithm to construct a PhyTree.
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getLColFuncMap(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> matrixPrime)
      Creates the LColFuncMap which maps the column to the largest L-function value in the column This function is different from TreeChecker's getLColFuncMap because it assumes the input matrix is a legitimate tree.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method Essentially, a wrapper function which first checks if building a tree is possible, then generates the tree.
      private void VisualizeTree(edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.DirectedGraph<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> g)
      Creates the actual graphics and sets up visualizing the tree Uses a combination of JUNG and Java's Swing libraries to display tree.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method Essentially, a wrapper function which first checks if building a tree is possible, then generates the tree.
        Parameters:
        args - Main's normal args parameter

      • buildTree

        private void buildTree(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> matrixPrime,
             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> lColFuncMap)
        Builds the PhyTree when given M' and the LColFuncMap Uses Gusfield's 1991 phylogenetic tree algorithm to construct a PhyTree. The graph data structures are taken from the JUNG library, a graph package for Java.
        Parameters:
        matrixPrime - M'
        lColFuncMap - The LColFuncMap made from getLColFuncMap

      • VisualizeTree

        private void VisualizeTree(edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.DirectedGraph<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> g)
        Creates the actual graphics and sets up visualizing the tree Uses a combination of JUNG and Java's Swing libraries to display tree. This might be made into it's own class if necessary.
        Parameters:
        g - A specific instance of a DirectedGraph built already

      • getLColFuncMap

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getLColFuncMap(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> matrixPrime)
        Creates the LColFuncMap which maps the column to the largest L-function value in the column This function is different from TreeChecker's getLColFuncMap because it assumes the input matrix is a legitimate tree. Thus, we can just fill in the L-values and find each column's max.
        Parameters:
        matrixPrime - M'
        Returns:
        A HashMap of column indices to its respective greatest L-value
